intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. spinuligera, commonly known as the spiny conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its spinose (spiny) bracts and the presence of glandular hairs on its foliage. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions. This plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and salt stress.
